content.description: This climb follows an offwidth crack to a ledge. Then go up a chimney to natural anchors. It has good friction on crystalline rock.
content.protection: I may have placed a large bong on the offwidth to my right in the picture.  I hung aiders for smaller students on the lower section.
content.location: This climb is on the group of large boulders below the main summit.  I believe I bushwhacked around the east side to get to the base.

content.description:
This route climbs the

Palmer Route

free without aid. There are 3 bolts that now protect the climb. The crux is at the second bolt, and once past the 3rd bolt, it's 5.easy to the top.
content.protection: A #5 new BD cam can protect the start and 3 quickdraws.
content.location: It ascends the Northeast side of the summit block.

content.description: The route originally had one aid bolt to surmount a bulge low on the climb, and it goes up a 5.7 face above to a bolt on top. I recall working on free climbing the route in the 1970s at about 5.11.
content.protection: One bolt (old and rusty now) on the face and one for a belay, probably risky to use now if they are still there.
content.location: It is on the north side of the prominent, large boulder at the summit.
